Featured Projects

A portfolio of sorts, including interesting things I've made or have taken part in making.

Frameless

An idea for a new type of grid for adaptive web design. Frameless is a fixed-width grid that you can use to adapt your design column by column, instead of pixel by pixel.

framelessgrid.com/

Golden Grid System

A grid system for use in responsive web design. Contains a fluid grid with “folding” columns, elastic gutters, a zoomable baseline grid, and a visually delightful grid overlay script.

goldengridsystem.com/

Less Framework

The ancestor of Frameless. A CSS grid system for designing adaptive websites using four static-width layouts: 320, 480, 768, and 992 px. Instead of stretching or contracting as the screen size changes, Less Framework simply gains or loses columns. No matter the screen size, the column sizes stay the same, making it easy to reuse design elements across the four layouts.

lessframework.com/

Adaptive MMO User Interface

A concept user interface for a massive multiplayer online game, designed using the principles of adaptive web design and Mobile First. Developed entirely using CSS3 and Javascript.

Coming soon.

Little Picture

My discontinued blog about the little details in design. It hasn’t aged particularly well, but it’s still worth a look, since it was also one of my first adaptive designs.

littlepicture.eu/archives/
